comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Porter_Charlton NYT of Jan 27, 1916 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E00E5DF1231E733A... indicates that Porter Charlton returned from Naples on the Italian liner America, after serving a brief sentence for the murder of his wife in 1910. He was met by J.W. Johnston of Western Electric, who had apparently arrange for Charlton to sell his story to the newspapers. See earlier picture, which probably is when he was extradited to Italy:

comment.author: 10771167@N00
comment._content: A 1919 passport photo of Charlton is here: In 1919 he is living in Paris and lists his profession as an employee of the US Postal Express Service. In 1922 he working as an agent of the American Graves Registration Service. He took his own life at Bayonne, France on November 24th, 1933.
